meanings.definition: Work done in addition to one's main job or occupation.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his shift at the factory, he took on some bywork cleaning houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys painting as a bywork to her full-time job as a teacher.
meanings.sent3: The accountant's bywork of knitting scarves for charity kept her busy during the evenings.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for photography became a bywork that brought color to her life.
meanings.sent5: The bywork of gardening brought him a sense of peace and accomplishment.

meanings.definition: A secondary or supplementary task or activity.
meanings.sent1: In addition to his studies, he took on the bywork of tutoring other students in math.
meanings.sent2: Her hobby of baking cakes became a delightful bywork that brought joy to her friends and family.
meanings.sent3: The bywork of organizing her bookshelf by color amused her more than she expected.
meanings.sent4: The bywork of learning a new language opened up a whole new world of possibilities for her.
meanings.sent5: The bywork of collecting stamps turned into a fascinating journey through different cultures.
